title: Wrestling Trials Behind Closed Doors:  Controversy Erupts Over Exemption for Top Athletes
content:
The Asian Games wrestling trials will be held behind closed doors after a heated debate erupted over the exemption granted to Olympic medalists Bajrang Punia and Vinesh Phogat.  Families of other wrestlers protested the decision, alleging unfairness and demanding equal opportunities.

The ad-hoc committee, appointed by the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) to manage the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI), has decided to proceed with the trials as scheduled, despite the controversy.  The decision to hold the event behind closed doors aims to minimize further disruptions and ensure a smooth selection process.  

This decision highlights the ongoing tensions within Indian wrestling, where disputes over selection criteria and fairness continue to overshadow the sport.
